Key Arguments: The legislation is viewed as a form of censorship and an overreach by the government.
The submission compares the legislation to actions taken by intelligence agencies to control narratives, as revealed by the 'Twitter files'.
The author argues that citizens have the right to access all information and opinions without government filtering.
The submission suggests that the legislation undermines informed consent, drawing parallels to the COVID-19 pandemic response.
Notable Quotes: This proposed legislation is nothing less than the woke nanny state on steroids.
The citizens of this country have the capacity and the right, as is enshrined in any free democracy, to access all information and opinion regardless of its source and content.

I oppose this proposed bill with every fibre of my being - if it walks like fascism, talks like fascism and removes in any shape, manner or form, the right to choice (as this unarguably will do) then it IS fascism.
